title: Donald Trump expects lower fentanyl tariff, Nvidia talks with Xi Jinping
description: Donald Trump said he expects to lower the tariffs the US has imposed on Chinese goods over the fentanyl crisis and speak with China’s Xi Jinping about Nvidia Corp.’s flagship Blackwell artificial intelligence chip, as leaders of the world’s biggest economies seek to ease tensions in a meeting on Thursday. “I expect to be lowering that because I believe they’re going to help us with the fentanyl situation,” Trump told reporters on Air Force One as he headed to South Korea on Wednesday
content:
Trump said he expected Beijing would be “doing things” and work with him directly to address the export of precursor chemicals critical to manufacturing fentanyl. He didn’t provide further details on the magnitude of the tariff reduction.

title: Microsoft holds 27% of OpenAI in revamped partnership
description: Microsoft and OpenAI announced Tuesday a sweeping overhaul of their landmark artificial intelligence (AI) partnership, giving both companies greater independence while maintaining their close collaboration.

title: Japan's Nikkei crosses 51,000 for first time on tech optimism
description: Japan's Nikkei share average surged past the key 51,000 level for the first time on Wednesday, underpinned by investor optimism over artificial intelligence sector investments.
content:
TOKYO, Oct 29 (Reuters) - Japan's Nikkei share average surged past the key 51,000 level for the first time on Wednesday, underpinned by investor optimism over artificial intelligence sector investments.

title: SK hynix posts record $7.9 billion profit on AI
description: South Korean chipmaker SK hynix has achieved record profits. Strong demand for artificial intelligence chips fueled this success. The company leads in high-bandwidth memory semiconductors. SK hynix is a key supplier for Nvidia. This marks the second consecutive quarter of record earnings. Strategic partnerships with AI giants are further boosting momentum.
content:

title: Amazon Web Services to invest $5 billion in South Korea, presidential office says
description: Amazon Web Services plans to invest at least $5 billion in South Korea by 2031 to establish new artificial intelligence data centers. This significant investment, announced during a meeting between AWS CEO Matt Garman and South Korean President Lee Jae Myung, aims to bolster the nation's AI industry and accelerate its growth as a global AI leader.

title: Asia stocks rise on AI and rates optimism
description: Asian shares were up with investors positive about new artificial intelligence deals, and confident of a 25-basis-point rate cut by the US Fed.
content:
Asian shares have had a lift from Wall Street thanks to a fresh wave of optimism over artificial intelligence, as investors braced for a busy day headlined by the Federal Reserve's decision and earnings from technology heavyweights.

title: Blocking China from US AI chips 'hurts us more' - Nvidia CEO
description: WASHINGTON, D.C. — Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang on Tuesday warned that the United States must allow the sale of US-made AI chips in China in order to ensure Silicon Valley companies remain a global powerhouse in providing artificial intelligence.
content:
WASHINGTON, D.C. — Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang on Tuesday warned that the United States must allow the sale of US-made AI chips in China in order to ensure Silicon Valley companies remain a global powerhouse in providing artificial intelligence.

title: Uber eyes fleet of 100,000 Nvidia
description: Uber Technologies Inc. is setting a goal to eventually have a fleet of 100,000 autonomous vehicles powered by Nvidia Corp. technology, an ambitious move that could help bring down the cost of offering hailable robotaxis to consumers. The companies expect the expansion to start in 2027, Nvidia said in a statement Tuesday. The announcement builds on an earlier partnership the two companies struck in January, with Uber agreeing to offer some of its driving data to help improve Nvidia’s artificial intelligence models and chip technology that carmakers can use to develop autonomous vehicles.
content:
Uber eyes fleet of 100,000 Nvidia-based robotaxis beginning 2027
